question: Which of the following is an example of the Hub-and-Spoke collaboration pattern in a Multi-Agent System?
options: All agents operate independently without any task coordination.
Each agent performs identical roles to ensure system redundancy.
A central Content Manager Agent assigns tasks to a Writer Agent, a Fact-Checker Agent, and an SEO Optimizer Agent.
A Retriever Agent gathers documents, then passes them to a Summarizer Agent, and finally to a Compiler Agent.
correct_answer: A central Content Manager Agent assigns tasks to a Writer Agent, a Fact-Checker Agent, and an SEO Optimizer Agent.
explanation: In the Hub-and-Spoke pattern, a central agent coordinates tasks among other agents, similar to a hub distributing tasks to spokes.
